text: Indian shares climbed, snapping a two-day losing streak, led by gains in the nation’s largest construction company Larsen and Toubro Ltd., after it reported better-than-anticipated earnings.The S&P BSE Sensex rose as much as 0.4 percent to 32,451.72 while the NSE Nifty 50 Index rose as much as 0.3 percent to 10,048.90. The market breadth was skewed in favour of the buyers.
title: Stocks Radar: Dena Bank, Lupin, L&T;, ONGC
